body:
yes. This is running from a distribution

> $ sha1sum go1.5.3.linux-amd64.tar.gz 
> c5377eca4837968d043b681f00a852a262f0f5f6  go1.5.3.linux-amd64.tar.gz

It seems that the relevant package got excluded:

> /usr/local/go $ find misc/tour/src -type d 
> misc/tour/src
> misc/tour/src/golang.org
> misc/tour/src/golang.org/x
> misc/tour/src/golang.org/x/tour
> misc/tour/src/golang.org/x/tour/wc
> misc/tour/src/golang.org/x/tour/pic
> misc/tour/src/golang.org/x/tour/tree

So, no -- it is not a bug in the language or the runtime.  If this issue is in the wrong place, maybe *that* is a bug in the tour code as well, because I created this issue from the link in the tour web ui.
